context: The country/entity with the most technology and wealth wins the drones wars. Winning against Iran will just take patience and a cool head. Reagan beat the Russians with a star wars approach. Saudi Arabia and it's allies can get Iran back in line by having a coordinated response.
Sending armed drones and missiles, just like bombers or ground troops into a country is an act of war, if you don't mind that...prepare to be conquered. If you do mind, fight back...hint, hint.

The best way to defend against drone attacks is to take them out before they take off. It is almost time to stop Iran dead in it's tracks. Just like Saudi Arabia, Iran can't fly their drones and aircraft without fuel. Saudi Arabia was attacked and they should be the ones who use an equal military response. If any country attacked a US oil factory I am sure they would have already faced the might of the US military.
WWD, World War Drone...sounds like a Star Wars sequel.

One way to address this is to turn a 10mile radius around the launch site for each drone or missile into a smoking hole in the ground, regardless of what lies inside that radius.

If that doesn't work, start with the closest known government center and obliterate it.  
This latest attack is a Saudi problem, the next attack on any US civilian or military target should be viewed as a declaration of war and all level of responses should be on the table.  It wouldn't take long to get Yemen under control.  If the Yemenis don't like that prospect, they can fix it themselves - now.

Well, a lot of companies are planning to use drone package delivery systems in near future. Probably a good time to buy a gun so you can shoot drones for fun. Shooting drones are allowed in states with stand your ground laws.

replies.context: Shooting down any aircraft is a federal offense.

context: I do not believe for one second that this attack was unstoppable.  The largest oil refinery on earth and it had no air defenses?? Please.... Nobody shot down the drones because they did not want to.  Best way to goad US into proxy war with Iran.

replies.context: The photos showed a NATO drone ? ? ?

context: Where is Luke Skywalker when you need him?
Intell has to know the manufacturer and origin of these drones by now. They just aren't saying. This could all end badly for everyone.
Forget the AR-15.  Drones are the new thing.  NRA will protect my right to own a drone ?
Carpet bomb the country of origin.  Problem solved.
There is more to this than we know. This is the future of warfare. Nanotechnology could be the answer to defend against this.
It's like having a pool full of gasoline in your backyard and fire flies aren't allowed to land in or on it.
Ban drones.

Attacking unarmed civilians with weapons of war? That is a violation of the Geneva Conventions. Let‚Äôs not usher in a new era of drone warfare, rather let governing bodies of the world realize that there is something cruel about the inherent lack of accountability with drones that will never be reconciled.

replies.context: Unfortunately, the Geneva Convention is only as valid as the nations that signed on to it.  Iran did not.

Saudi and the UAE, with US assistance, are the ones attacking unarmed civilians.

They've repeatedly bombed hospitals and even attacked a school bus full of children.

Now you're upset about an oil facility being attacked in which nobody was even hurt.
The method of attack, yes. The targets, yes.

How is this method of attack any different than what Saudi Arabia and Yemen have been doing?

And the target?  An oil facility as opposed to civilians and children?

context: Saudi Arabia was attacked by Iran, and the Saudis should be the ones that respond to them, not the U.S.

send more troops to the region yet apparently drone strikes and a defense against them is not 100%.  So are we giving them our troops for drone target practice?
The threat of drones had to be known to every military. Difficult to think this was a total surprise.
